p:
The inhibition studies were conducted with the use of a biolayer interferometry (BLI) assay.
4 In this assay a streptavidin coated sensor was loaded with a sialylated glycoprotein LAMP1. Influenza A virus WU95 (containing a H3 protein of a human H3N2 virus; see Supporting Information) was used, and its binding to the sensor could readily be observed. Performing the experiment in the presence of the inhibitors clearly showed inhibition ( Figure 3 a). By use of a range of concentrations for each compound, inhibition curves were obtained ( Figure 3 B) and the results were quantified ( Table 1 ).
